title: St Cajetan Novena - Prayers for Employment
description: St Cajetan was an Italian Catholic priest and religious reformer, co-founder of the Theatines. He is the patron saint of the unemployed.

days.prayer:
In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

O glorious St. Cajetan, you studied to be a lawyer, but when you felt that the Lord was calling you to His service, you abandoned everything and became a priest. You excelled in virtues, shunning all material rewards for your labor, helping the many unemployed people of your time. You provided loans without interest and you attracted benefactors who donated to your resources so that you could go on with your activities. Look on us with mercy. We wish to find employment that could help us and our families live with dignity. Listen to our petitions, dear saint; you, who could easily give up the food on your table for the needy, bring our petitions to Jesus (mention request here‚Ä¶) Amen.

Despite your busy schedule, dear saint, you spent eight hours a day in prayer. Your happiness consists in being united with Jesus, to savor his presence in the Eucharist. Guide us to be like you by giving priority to prayer in our life. Enable us to savor Jesus‚Äô presence and help us become contemplatives like you. Inspire us to understand that prayer is not just asking Jesus for our needs, but being with him, delighting in his presence. We ask you, dear saint, to lead us in this direction that we may learn to delight in Jesus‚Äô presence. Amen.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be St Cajetan, pray for us.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

We wish to find employment that could help us and our families live with dignity. Listen to our petitions, dear saint; you, who could easily give up the food on your table for the needy, bring our petitions to Jesus (mention request here‚Ä¶) Amen.

O glorious St. Cajetan, like the society where you lived, we are also beset by the same economic set up where the poor are becoming poorer and the rich, richer. You fasted so that the money you saved could be used to buy food for the poor, you did not accept any payment for your ministries because you wanted people to help the needy. You lived very frugally because you wanted to teach the rich about the need to share. Look with pity on our society where resources are wasted in buying useless goods, while the poor and the needy among us have not received the basic necessities. Inspire us to share that nobody among us would go hungry, and that everybody may live with dignity. Amen.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be St Cajetan, pray for us.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Listen to our petitions, dear saint; you, who could easily give up the food on your table for the needy, bring our petitions to Jesus (mention request here‚Ä¶) Amen.

O humble St. Cajetan, you spoke with rulers and kings, but you never gave them much importance. You know that prestige, honor, and positions in society could only be good if they are used to help the needy and the poor. For this reason, you also confronted tyrants and stood against armies that looted, killed, and raped. Your humility did not prevent you from becoming a prophet. You only feared Jesus. Help us to remain humble and self-effacing, knowing that before God, we remain nothing. We can only be someone if we stand close to Jesus. Inspire us to follow your footsteps so that we, too, may fight for justice and help stop corruption in our government. Amen.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be St Cajetan, pray for us.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Listen to our petitions, dear saint; you, who could easily give up the food on your table for the needy, bring our petitions to Jesus (mention request here‚Ä¶) Amen.

O glorious St. Cajetan, it pained you to see the Catholic Church divided into hostile groups. You always prayed for unity in the Church, asking laypersons, priests, and bishops to support the Pope through preaching, prayer, and sacrifices. You see the Church as the bride of Christ, the sacrament by which men and women can become holy. You worked hard for the return of the Protestants to the Catholic Church, and you preached against Protestant reformers who were attacking the heart of Catholic teachings. Teach us then to work for unity in our Church and at the same time, to defend her from sects and religious movements that attack her. Inspire us to follow your path. Amen.

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be St Cajetan, pray for us.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

I recently had a new business opportunity that I embarked on and after making the investment into it, the party went missing for 1 month and I feared for the worst.

from E.K.

I would like to write my testimony as my thanks to God and thanks to St. Cajetan.

As I was jobless, far away from my native land, I was sad and hurt deep inside myself because I saw myself stuck and saw my dreams shattered into pieces because of some individuals who forbid me to advance due to their jealousy and personal interest.

I needed to start again.

As I saw one day about the Novena to St. Cajetan, patron of the jobless, I prayed 9 days straight, praying to God and to him to give me soon a job so that I can finally fulfill my dreams and go back to my native land. After finishing the Novena and after more than 60 online application and 6 job interviews, I finally found a job and today I will start my training.

Thank you God, Thank you Jesus, Thank you Mary and thank you St. Cajetan for listening to my prayers. You heard this prayer of mine and You allow me to advance with my life projects when everything seems hopeless. You did not allow evil to have the final word. I will be forever grateful for this grace given and I promise to thank you once I reach heaven.

Amen
